component.text: Click each button to view the associated content.

An attacker is capturing packets using Wireshark on a local subnet. The attacker is particularly interested in TCP Telnet streams and notices that the administrator’s IP address (192.168.2.7) has initiated a Telnet session to a device.
By following the Telnet stream, the attacker has captured the administrator’s username (Bob) and password (cisco123).
When the administrator uses SSH, the attacker no longer sees Telnet packets and must instead filter by the administrator’s IP address.
When following the stream of data, the attacker only sees TCP and SSH packets which reveal useless encrypted information.
